trans-unit.source: Displays the value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_System.Web.UI.Page.User.Identity.Name" name="System.Web.UI.Page.User.Identity.Name" href=""></xref> property.

In this topic: - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Accessibility](#accessibility) - [Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax) ## Introduction By default, the LoginName control displays the name contained in the property of the class.
If the `System.Web.UI.Page.User.Identity.Name` property is empty, the control is not rendered.
> [!NOTE] > If you are not familiar with the set of login controls available in ASP.NET, see [ASP.NET Login Controls Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) before continuing.
For a list of other topics related to login controls and membership, see [Managing Users by Using Membership](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To change the text displayed by the LoginName control, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginName.FormatString%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > The LoginName control cannot be used outside the `<form>` tag on a Web page.
Specifically, the LoginName cannot be used to put the user's name in the title of a page.

## Accessibility For information about how to configure this control so that it generates markup that conforms to accessibility standards, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Declarative Syntax ``` ```
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginName"></xref> control to its default values.
Creates a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginName> control.
Provides a format item string to display.
The FormatString property contains a standard text format string that displays the user's name on the Web page.
The string "{0}" indicates where in the string the user's name is inserted.
The following table describes the available property settings.

|Property setting|Behavior| |----------------------|--------------| |Default ("{0}")|The user's name is displayed when the user is logged on; otherwise, nothing is displayed.| |<xref:System.String>|Same as default.
To hide the control, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Visible%2A> property to `false`.| |"Welcome to my site, {0}."|Displays the string "Welcome to my site, *username*."
when the user is logged in.
When the user is not logged in, nothing is displayed.| |"Welcome to my site."|When the FormatString property is set to a string, the string is displayed when the user is logged in.
Because the string does not contain "{0}", the user's name is not displayed.
When the user is not logged in, nothing is displayed.| The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A string containing format items for displaying the user's name.
The default value is "{0}".
The format string is not valid.
Renders the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginName"></xref> control to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that receives the rendered output.
Renders the HTML opening tag of the control to the specified writer.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object that represents the output stream that renders HTML content to the client.
Renders the contents of the control to the specified writer.
This method is used primarily by control developers.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object that represents the output stream that renders HTML content to the client.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginName.FormatString*> property is not set to a valid format string.
Renders the HTML closing tag of the control to the specified writer.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object that represents the output stream that renders HTML content to the client.

Gets a value that indicates whether the control should set the <xref uid="langword_csharp_disabled" name="disabled" href=""></xref> attribute of the rendered HTML element to "disabled" when the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.IsEnabled*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This property indicates how ASP.NET should render HTML for a control when the control is disabled.
If this property is `true`, ASP.NET renders a `disabled` attribute when a control is disabled.
If this property is `false`, ASP.NET renders a `class` attribute when a control is disabled.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.SupportsDisabledAttribute%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderingCompatibility%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property indicates an ASP.NET version lower than `4.0`; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
